glossentry.glossdef:
A software distribution is composed of components and complementary data and configurations. A Software Distribution is put together by a provider in order to make the software available to one or more recipients. Depending upon context and relationship between provider and recipient of a software distribution, the license conditions of the contained components must be considered. A Software Distribution can take different characteristics. A software distribution can be converted for instance by an executable file, an archive or a file system image.
See also: ,
